alert.note: Alert for Darke; Miami; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 5:03PM EDT until May 21 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Darke, Miami and Preble. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Troy, Piqua, Greenville, Eaton, West Milton, Versailles, Covington, Arcanum, Bradford, Lewisburg, New Paris, Pleasant Hill, New Madison, Webster, Wayne Lakes, Gettysburg, Eldorado, Verona, West Manchester and Laura.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
